decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost white creatures, quickly building a strong board presence. By utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Always Watching, the deck aims to pump up these small creatures and make them more threatening. The deck also includes removal spells like Declaration in Stone to deal with any opposing threats. The overall strategy is to be fast and aggressive, pushing through damage early on and maintaining pressure throughout the game.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays with efficient creatures and spells. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures with abilities that boost each other, such as Thalia's Lieutenant and Lambholt Pacifist. The deck also utilizes powerful spells like Collected Company and Dromoka's Command to provide additional flexibility and control on the battlefield. By consistently putting pressure on the opponent early in the game, this deck aims to establish dominance and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures to control the game and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. It aims to stall the game with counterspells like Clash of Wills and Spell Shrivel while using removal spells such as Spatial Contortion and Kozilek's Return to deal with threats. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Drowner of Hope, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and planeswalkers like Chandra, Flamecaller and Jace, Unraveler of Secrets to close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently disrupted.

The main focus of this deck is to rapidly deploy aggressive creatures onto the battlefield, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers to generate additional threats. The deck synergizes well with cards that generate additional creatures, such as Hangarback Walker and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar, to quickly overwhelm opponents. Evolutionary Leap and Oath of Nissa provide card advantage and help to find key pieces of the deck. Dromoka's Command and Declaration in Stone offer removal options to deal with opposing threats. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and close out games quickly.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Duskwatch Recruiter, Lambholt Pacifist, and Thraben Inspector. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Reflector Mage, the deck aims to control the battlefield and maintain pressure on the opponent. Thalia's Lieutenant and Tireless Tracker provide additional buffs and card advantage to help secure a victory. With a mix of creatures and commands, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggression and tempo, making it a formidable force in 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with different abilities and mana ramp to quickly overwhelm the opponent and control the board. By using cards like Duskwatch Recruiter and Reflector Mage, the deck can maintain a fast pace while disrupting the opponent's strategy. With the help of Eldrazi Displacer and Reality Smasher, the deck can deal heavy damage and finish the game swiftly. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Sylvan Advocate and Elvish Visionary provides both power and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to establish dominance early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing ramp cards such as Explosive Vegetation and Nissa's Pilgrimage to quickly accelerate into powerful late-game threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Dragonlord Atarka. Control elements are included with cards like Kozilek's Return and Chandra, Flamecaller to manage the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to establish dominance on the battlefield through massive creatures and powerful spells, overwhelming the opponent with sheer size and strength. The combination of green ramp and control elements creates a versatile and formidable strategy capable of outlasting and outmatching opponents.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing an aggressive board presence with efficient creatures and disruption spells. The key strategy is to control the board with counterspells and removal, while maintaining pressure with evasive creatures like Reflector Mage and Dimensional Infiltrator. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar can create tokens to further pressure the opponent. Bygone Bishop provides card advantage while Rattlechains offers protection and tempo advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and control to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells while maintaining a steady stream of card advantage. By leveraging the power of cards like Reflector Mage and Collected Company, the deck aims to control the board while applying pressure with creatures like Sylvan Advocate and Eldrazi Skyspawner. The inclusion of cards like Archangel Avacyn and Eldrazi Displacer provides additional versatility and ways to protect key threats. Overall, the deck focuses on tempo and aggressiveness to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 setting.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence through efficient creatures like Eldrazi Skyspawner and Reflector Mage, while using cards like Cryptolith Rite and Collected Company to ramp up mana and quickly play powerful threats like Reality Smasher. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive plays and tempo advantage, while also having some resilience and value generation through cards like Duskwatch Recruiter and Elvish Visionary. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all three colors of mana for the deck's spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards to manipulate the game in your favor, while also utilizing dragons for added win conditions. Dragonlord Ojutai and Dragonlord Silumgar provide strong threats while Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Sorin, Grim Nemesis offer card advantage and removal. The deck includes a variety of counterspells and removal spells to control the board, along with card draw to maintain resources. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three color identity, allowing for consistent casting of spells and dragons.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game by using powerful Planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Sorin, Grim Nemesis to dominate the battlefield. The inclusion of removal spells like Anguished Unmaking and Grasp of Darkness allows for efficient removal of threats while cards like Secure the Wastes and Westvale Abbey create additional threats. Languish and Ruinous Path provide board wipes to reset the game if needed, while Read the Bones and Transgress the Mind provide card advantage and disruption to the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle using creatures like Hangarback Walker, Sylvan Advocate, and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Nissa, Voice of Zendikar and Gideon, as well as removal spells like Dromoka's Command and Tragic Arrogance, the deck aims to control the board and maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Westvale Abbey and Evolutionary Leap provide additional ways to generate threats and maintain board presence throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with low-cost creatures and powerful planeswalker cards. By utilizing cards like Hangarback Walker and Sylvan Advocate to apply early pressure, followed by Archangel Avacyn and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar to maintain control of the battlefield, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats. Nissa, Voice of Zendikar helps to pump up the team, while Dromoka's Command provides removal and utility. The deck also includes mana fixing and card advantage to ensure consistency and resilience in the face of opposition.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of efficient creatures and powerful planeswalkers to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck focuses on playing creatures like Hangarback Walker and Sylvan Advocate early on to apply pressure, while using cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar to further strengthen the board. The inclusion of removal spells like Dromoka's Command and Stasis Snare helps to deal with opposing threats, while cards like Archangel Avacyn provide additional protection for the deck's creatures.

The deck focuses on flooding the board with small creatures, utilizing cards like Hangarback Walker and Sylvan Advocate, then bolstering them with Anthem effects from cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with the sheer number of threats on the board, while also having control options like Dromoka's Command and Tragic Arrogance for removal. Westvale Abbey can be used as a finisher if the game goes long, providing a powerful threat in Ormendahl, Profane Prince.
